text: Jennifer "Jen" Psaki (Virginia; born December 1, 1978) is an American White House Press Secretary, Previously serving under the administration of President Joseph Robinette Biden, Jr. She was White House Communications Director from 2015 to 2017 during the Barack Obama presidency. She has also been a CNN contributor. In November 2020, Joe Biden announced Psaki his pick for White House Press Secretary. She told Biden that she would be press secretary until 2022, only a year into her term. On April 1, 2022, Axios reported that Psaki would likely leave the White House "around May" for a job with MSNBC. On May 5, 2022, the White House announced she would be leaving the role on May 13, 2022 and named her principal deputy, Karine Jean-Pierre, as her successor. ==References== Category:1978 births Category:Living people Category:White House Communications Directors Category:American political commentators Category:CNN people Category:Politicians from Connecticut Category:People from Stamford, Connecticut Category:People from Greenwich, Connecticut Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:White House Press Secretaries
title: Jen Psaki
